import Prerequisites from '@site/src/components/Prerequisites'; import LearningObjective from '@site/src/components/LearningObjective'; import Outcome from '@site/src/components/Outcome'; import SuccessCriteria from '@site/src/components/SuccessCriteria'; import Exercise from '@site/src/components/Exercise'; import Checkpoint from '@site/src/components/Checkpoint'; Chapter 4: Basic Robot Control This chapter will cover basic robot control techniques, including teleoperation and simple movements.

You should have a simulated robot running in Gazebo and be comfortable with basic ROS 2 concepts.
  • Understand the concept of robot teleoperation.
  • Learn how to control a robot using a keyboard or joystick.
  • Be able to write a simple ROS 2 node to make a robot move autonomously.
 Teleoperation Teleoperation is the process of controlling a robot from a distance. In ROS 2, this is typically done by running a teleoperation node that reads input from a keyboard, joystick, or other device and publishes velocity commands to a topic. The standard topic for velocity commands is /cmdvel, and the message type is geometrymsgs/msg/Twist. A Twist message contains two vectors: linear (for x, y, z velocity) and angular (for roll, pitch, yaw velocity). Simple Autonomous Movement To make a robot move on its own, you can write a ROS 2 node that publishes Twist messages to the /cmd_vel topic. By controlling the linear and angular velocities over time, you can make the robot follow a specific path. For example, to make a robot drive in a straight line, you would publish a Twist message with a constant positive linear.x value and zero for all other values. To make it turn, you would publish a message with a positive or negative angular.z value.

What is the name and message type of the standard ROS 2 topic for robot velocity commands?

Write a ROS 2 Python node that makes your simulated robot drive in a circle. You will need to publish a Twist message with a constant linear.x and a constant angular.z.

You can now make a robot move! This is a fundamental skill that you will build upon in the coming chapters.</
